author: ratz
title: not as bad as it looks
review:
i probably should review 4561, since it is almost the same, but actually i do have 4560, so here it is:
somewhere someone mentioned that this train was inspired by the train of the euro-tunnel (connecting france and the uk), so it has a hypermodern design with lots of glas (why? to watch the tunnel walls?) and an aerodynamic front. it may be not the prettiest train, and it may not look so modern anymore, but the parts that come in this set are quite useful: window panes, split-level waggon bases, many people, and a train motor, wheels, and track. 
it is even still available in some shops, so why not buy it and have a nice train-extension-pack?

author: Tantive_IV
title: Childhood Memories
review:
Okay first thing first! 
This set is the same as the 4561 Railway Express... The only difference is that this set doesn't have a speed generator, and the 4561 has. 

I remember when this set came out in 1999. I wanted it so badly, but never got it. 


1996 age 0: I'm born in Slagelse, Denmark.

2001 age 5: I take with my Mum and dad from Slagelse (Denmark) to Vejle (Denmark) close to the Danish Legoland, Billund. I See it in a store, and I still want it. At that time I costed like: 1100 DKK (Denmark), 147,54 EUR (Europa), 202,75 USD (USA), 125,93 GBP (UK), 16567,23 JPY (Japan). 

2002 age 6: I get a baby brother called Daniel 

2004 age 8: I start collecting model trains. At this point I've forgotten all about this set!

2006 age 10: I start collecting lego worldcity sets. 

2007 age 11: Some random weekend my mum, my brother and I goes to the library. My brother Daniel plays Lego Star Wars II, the Original Saga. Later the year Daniel and I starts collecting Lego Star Wars. 

2011 age 15: I start finding my old Lego Worldcity. Just now (26th of February 2011), I receive the set from a man in Germany
And I love it.

It has all the details and all the minifigs. to make it perfect. There is room fore all the cats in the 2. wagon. A cinema and a small restaurant. The Platform is a little small but it doesn't matter. 
This set is hard to describe because it is one of the sets I like the most. You should get this or the 4561!
